The Recipe Database Component

We continue with a senario. Ignoring, for the moment, the possibility of creating or planning meals, we continue with a use-case that has the user electing to explore the database of recipies. Having selected this choice, control is then passing to the recipe database component, which is separate and independent of the greeter.

The recipe database component is involved in all activities that involve direct access to the database. This means the recipe database must provide a number of different services. These include the following:

  • Must Maintain the Database of Recipes.
  • Must Allow the user to browse the database.
  • Must permit the user to edit or annotate an existing recipe.
  • Must permit the user to add a new recipe.
